  • Method Details

    • Menu_Query

      public void Menu_Query(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws SQLException
      The Menu_Query function gets every menu item that is in the database and turns them into buttons which can then be pressed on the GUI. It will get called at the beginning and whenever a change happens to a menu item such as price change and add a new button if a new menu item is made.
      Parameters:
      e - Not used but it is available if we want to make the query into a button
      Throws:
      SQLException - If database communicatino isn't done correctly

    • Addon_Query

      public void Addon_Query(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws SQLException
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • Drink_Query

      public void Drink_Query(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws SQLException
      When the drinks category is selected the Vbox and scroll pane element are popoulated. The action event argument is in place for compatablity with javaFX controllers. When the Vbox is populated it is populated with javaFX buttons that add to the order.

      This method executes on button press every time. Even if the Vbox is already populated

      Parameters:
      e - An action event not defined by the user. Only used to run on button press.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if not connected to database

    • SubmitOrder

      public void SubmitOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws SQLException
      Submits a new order to the database, clearing the current order data from the GUI upon successful execution. This method first establishes a connection to the database using provided credentials, retrieves a new order ID by executing a SQL query, and then submits order details including menu items, drinks, and add-ons. Finally, it clears the current order data from the interface.
      Parameters:
      e - the ActionEvent triggered by submitting the order, not used in the method but required for interface compatibility
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is any issue with the database connection, executing queries, or other SQL-related operations. This includes issues such as invalid credentials, unreachable database server, malformed SQL queries, and failure in executing the * prepared statements. This method directly affects the state of the database and the GUI, and it handles all SQLExceptions by printing stack trace. Proper exception handling and user feedback mechanisms should be implemented in a production environment.

    • RemoveLast

      public void RemoveLast(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Removes the last item from the list and updates the order total.
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent that triggers the removal of the last item

    • ClearOrder

      public void ClearOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Clears the entire order by removing all items from the lists and resetting the order total to zero.
      Parameters:
      e - The ActionEvent that triggers the clearing of the order.

    • logoutBtnAction

      public void logoutBtnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Changes to manager page when the logout button is pressed
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException - if FXML is not in the resources folder or found in project
